trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Halogen Software
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Halogen Software

trans-unit.source: Learn how to configure single sign-on between Azure Active Directory and Halogen Software.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to configure single sign-on between Azure Active Directory and Halogen Software.

trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Halogen Software
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Halogen Software

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show you how to integrate Halogen Software with Azure Active Directory (Azure AD).<html></html>Integrating Halogen Software with Azure AD provides you with the following benefits:
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show you how to integrate Halogen Software with Azure Active Directory (Azure AD).<html></html>Integrating Halogen Software with Azure AD provides you with the following benefits:

trans-unit.source: You can control in Azure AD who has access to Halogen Software
trans-unit.target: You can control in Azure AD who has access to Halogen Software

trans-unit.source: You can enable your users to automatically get signed-on to Halogen Software (Single Sign-On) with their Azure AD accounts
trans-unit.target: You can enable your users to automatically get signed-on to Halogen Software (Single Sign-On) with their Azure AD accounts

trans-unit.source: You can manage your accounts in one central location - the Azure Active Directory Portal
trans-unit.target: You can manage your accounts in one central location - the Azure Active Directory Portal

trans-unit.source: If you want to know more details about SaaS app integration with Azure AD, see <link><linkText>What is application access and single sign-on with Azure Active Directory</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: If you want to know more details about SaaS app integration with Azure AD, see <link><linkText>What is application access and single sign-on with Azure Active Directory</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: To configure Azure AD integration with Halogen Software, you need the following items:
trans-unit.target: To configure Azure AD integration with Halogen Software, you need the following items:

trans-unit.source: An Azure AD subscription
trans-unit.target: An Azure AD subscription

trans-unit.source: A Halogen Software single-sign on enabled subscription
trans-unit.target: A Halogen Software single-sign on enabled subscription

trans-unit.source: To test the steps in this tutorial, we do not recommend using a production environment.
trans-unit.target: To test the steps in this tutorial, we do not recommend using a production environment.

trans-unit.source: To test the steps in this tutorial, you should follow these recommendations:
trans-unit.target: To test the steps in this tutorial, you should follow these recommendations:

trans-unit.source: You should not use your production environment, unless this is necessary.
trans-unit.target: You should not use your production environment, unless this is necessary.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an Azure AD trial environment, you can get a one-month trial <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an Azure AD trial environment, you can get a one-month trial <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Scenario Description
trans-unit.target: Scenario Description

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to enable you to test Azure AD single sign-on in a test environment. <html></html>
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to enable you to test Azure AD single sign-on in a test environment. <html></html>

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of three main building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of three main building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Adding Halogen Software from the gallery
trans-unit.target: Adding Halogen Software from the gallery

trans-unit.source: Configuring and testing Azure AD single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring and testing Azure AD single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Adding Halogen Software from the gallery
trans-unit.target: Adding Halogen Software from the gallery

trans-unit.source: To configure the integration of Halogen Software into Azure AD, you need to add Halogen Software from the gallery to your list of managed SaaS apps.
trans-unit.target: To configure the integration of Halogen Software into Azure AD, you need to add Halogen Software from the gallery to your list of managed SaaS apps.

trans-unit.source: To add Halogen Software from the gallery, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To add Halogen Software from the gallery, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type halogen software.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type halogen software.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select Halogen Software, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select Halogen Software, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: Configuring and testing Azure AD single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring and testing Azure AD single sign-on

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to show you how to configure and test Azure AD single sign-on with Halogen Software based on a test user called "Britta Simon".
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to show you how to configure and test Azure AD single sign-on with Halogen Software based on a test user called "Britta Simon".

trans-unit.source: For single sign-on to work, Azure AD needs to know what the counterpart user in Halogen Software to an user in Azure AD is. In other words, a link relationship between an Azure AD user and the related user in Halogen Software needs to be established.<html></html>
trans-unit.target: For single sign-on to work, Azure AD needs to know what the counterpart user in Halogen Software to an user in Azure AD is. In other words, a link relationship between an Azure AD user and the related user in Halogen Software needs to be established.<html></html>

trans-unit.source: This link relationship is established by assigning the value of the user name in Azure AD as the value of the Username in Halogen Software.
trans-unit.target: This link relationship is established by assigning the value of the user name in Azure AD as the value of the Username in Halogen Software.

trans-unit.source: To configure and test Azure AD single sign-on with Halogen Software, you need to complete the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: To configure and test Azure AD single sign-on with Halogen Software, you need to complete the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: **<link><linkText>Configuring Azure AD Single Single Sign-On</linkText><title></title></link>** - to enable your users to use this feature.
trans-unit.target: **<link><linkText>Configuring Azure AD Single Single Sign-On</linkText><title></title></link>** - to enable your users to use this feature.

trans-unit.source: **<link><linkText>Creating an Azure AD test user</linkText><title></title></link>** - to test Azure AD single sign-on with Britta Simon.
trans-unit.target: **<link><linkText>Creating an Azure AD test user</linkText><title></title></link>** - to test Azure AD single sign-on with Britta Simon.

trans-unit.source: **<link><linkText>Creating a Halogen Software test user</linkText><title></title></link>** - to have a counterpart of Britta Simon in Halogen Software that is linked to the Azure AD representation of her.
trans-unit.target: **<link><linkText>Creating a Halogen Software test user</linkText><title></title></link>** - to have a counterpart of Britta Simon in Halogen Software that is linked to the Azure AD representation of her.

trans-unit.source: **<link><linkText>Assigning the Azure AD test user</linkText><title></title></link>** - to enable Britta Simon to use Azure AD single sign-on.
trans-unit.target: **<link><linkText>Assigning the Azure AD test user</linkText><title></title></link>** - to enable Britta Simon to use Azure AD single sign-on.

trans-unit.source: **<link><linkText>Testing Single Sign-On</linkText><title></title></link>** - to verify whether the configuration works.
trans-unit.target: **<link><linkText>Testing Single Sign-On</linkText><title></title></link>** - to verify whether the configuration works.

trans-unit.source: Configuring Azure AD Single Single Sign-On
trans-unit.target: Configuring Azure AD Single Single Sign-On

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to enable Azure AD single sign-on in the Azure AD portal and to configure single sign-on in your Halogen Software application.<html></html>
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to enable Azure AD single sign-on in the Azure AD portal and to configure single sign-on in your Halogen Software application.<html></html>

trans-unit.source: To configure Azure AD single sign-on with Halogen Software, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To configure Azure AD single sign-on with Halogen Software, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the Halogen Software application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the Configure Single Sign-On dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the Halogen Software application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the Configure Single Sign-On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to Halogen Software page, select Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to Halogen Software page, select Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure AD Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure AD Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App Settings dialog page, perform the following steps: Configure App Settings
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App Settings dialog page, perform the following steps: Configure App Settings

trans-unit.source: 1 in the Sign On URL textbox, type your URL used by your users to sign on to your Halogen Software application using the following pattern: https://global.hgncloud.com/fabrikam/welcome.jsp
trans-unit.target: 1 in the Sign On URL textbox, type your URL used by your users to sign on to your Halogen Software application using the following pattern: https://global.hgncloud.com/fabrikam/welcome.jsp

trans-unit.source: Click Next.
trans-unit.target: Click Next.

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at Halogen Software page, click Download metadata, and then save the metadata file locally on your computer.What is Azure AD Connect
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at Halogen Software page, click Download metadata, and then save the metadata file locally on your computer.What is Azure AD Connect

trans-unit.source: In a different browser window, sign-on to your Halogen Software application as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: In a different browser window, sign-on to your Halogen Software application as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: Click the Options tab. What is Azure AD Connect
trans-unit.target: Click the Options tab. What is Azure AD Connect

trans-unit.source: In the left navigation pane, click SAML Configuration. What is Azure AD Connect
trans-unit.target: In the left navigation pane, click SAML Configuration. What is Azure AD Connect

trans-unit.source: On the SAML Configuration page, perform the following steps: What is Azure AD Connect
trans-unit.target: On the SAML Configuration page, perform the following steps: What is Azure AD Connect

trans-unit.source: As Unique Identifier, select NameID.
trans-unit.target: As Unique Identifier, select NameID.

trans-unit.source: As Unique Identifier Maps To, select Username.
trans-unit.target: As Unique Identifier Maps To, select Username.

trans-unit.source: To upload your downloaded metadata file, click Browse to select the file, and then Upload File.
trans-unit.target: To upload your downloaded metadata file, click Browse to select the file, and then Upload File.

trans-unit.source: To test the configuration, click Run Test. > [AZURE.NOTE] You need to wait for the message "The SAML test is complete. Please close this window". Then, close the opened browser window. The Enable SAML checkbox is only enabled if the test has been completed.
trans-unit.target: To test the configuration, click Run Test. > [AZURE.NOTE] You need to wait for the message "The SAML test is complete. Please close this window". Then, close the opened browser window. The Enable SAML checkbox is only enabled if the test has been completed.

trans-unit.source: Select Enable SAML.
trans-unit.target: Select Enable SAML.

trans-unit.source: Click Save Changes.
trans-unit.target: Click Save Changes.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog. What is Azure AD Connect
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog. What is Azure AD Connect

trans-unit.source: On the Single sign-on confirmation page, click Complete. What is Azure AD Connect
trans-unit.target: On the Single sign-on confirmation page, click Complete. What is Azure AD Connect

trans-unit.source: Creating an Azure AD test user
trans-unit.target: Creating an Azure AD test user

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to create a test user in the Azure portal called Britta Simon.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to create a test user in the Azure portal called Britta Simon.

trans-unit.source: To create a test user in Azure AD, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To create a test user in Azure AD, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html><linkText>What is Azure AD Connect</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html><linkText>What is Azure AD Connect</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To display the list of users, in the menu on the top, click Users.
trans-unit.target: To display the list of users, in the menu on the top, click Users.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html><linkText>What is Azure AD Connect</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html><linkText>What is Azure AD Connect</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To open the Add User dialog, in the toolbar on the bottom, click Add User.
trans-unit.target: To open the Add User dialog, in the toolbar on the bottom, click Add User.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html><linkText>What is Azure AD Connect</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html><linkText>What is Azure AD Connect</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Tell us about this user dialog page, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the Tell us about this user dialog page, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html><linkText>What is Azure AD Connect</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html><linkText>What is Azure AD Connect</linkText>

trans-unit.source: As Type Of User, select New user in your organization.
trans-unit.target: As Type Of User, select New user in your organization.

trans-unit.source: In the User Name textbox, type BrittaSimon.
trans-unit.target: In the User Name textbox, type BrittaSimon.

trans-unit.source: Click Next.
trans-unit.target: Click Next.

trans-unit.source: On the User Profile dialog page, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the User Profile dialog page, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html><linkText>What is Azure AD Connect</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html><linkText>What is Azure AD Connect</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the First Name textbox, type Britta.
trans-unit.target: In the First Name textbox, type Britta.

trans-unit.source: In the Last Name txtbox, type, Simon.
trans-unit.target: In the Last Name txtbox, type, Simon.

trans-unit.source: In the Display Name textbox, type Britta Simon.
trans-unit.target: In the Display Name textbox, type Britta Simon.

trans-unit.source: In the Role list, select User.
trans-unit.target: In the Role list, select User.

trans-unit.source: Click Next.
trans-unit.target: Click Next.

trans-unit.source: On the Get temporary password dialog page, click create.
trans-unit.target: On the Get temporary password dialog page, click create.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html><linkText>What is Azure AD Connect</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html><linkText>What is Azure AD Connect</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Get temporary password dialog page, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the Get temporary password dialog page, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html><linkText>What is Azure AD Connect</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html><linkText>What is Azure AD Connect</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Write down the value of the New Password.
trans-unit.target: Write down the value of the New Password.

trans-unit.source: Click Complete.
trans-unit.target: Click Complete.

trans-unit.source: Creating a Halogen Software test user
trans-unit.target: Creating a Halogen Software test user

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to create a user called Britta Simon in Halogen Software.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to create a user called Britta Simon in Halogen Software.

trans-unit.source: To create a user called Britta Simon in Halogen Software, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To create a user called Britta Simon in Halogen Software, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Sign on to your Halogen Software application as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: Sign on to your Halogen Software application as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: Click the User Center tab, and then click Create User.
trans-unit.target: Click the User Center tab, and then click Create User.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html><linkText>What is Azure AD Connect</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html><linkText>What is Azure AD Connect</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the New User dialog page, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the New User dialog page, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html><linkText>What is Azure AD Connect</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html><linkText>What is Azure AD Connect</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the First Name textbox, type Britta.
trans-unit.target: In the First Name textbox, type Britta.

trans-unit.source: In the Last Name textbox, type Simon.
trans-unit.target: In the Last Name textbox, type Simon.

trans-unit.source: In the Username textbox, type Brita Simon's user name in the Azure AD portal.
trans-unit.target: In the Username textbox, type Brita Simon's user name in the Azure AD portal.

trans-unit.source: In the Password textbox, type a password for Britta.
trans-unit.target: In the Password textbox, type a password for Britta.

trans-unit.source: Click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Save.

trans-unit.target: Assigning the Azure AD test user

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to enabling Britta Simon to use Azure single sign-on by granting her access to Halogen Software.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to enabling Britta Simon to use Azure single sign-on by granting her access to Halogen Software.

trans-unit.target: On the Azure portal, to open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html><linkText>What is Azure AD Connect</linkText>

trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html><linkText>What is Azure AD Connect</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Testing Single Sign-On
trans-unit.target: Testing Single Sign-On

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to test your Azure AD single sign-on configuration using the Access Panel.<html></html>
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to test your Azure AD single sign-on configuration using the Access Panel.<html></html>

trans-unit.source: When you click the Halogen Software tile in the Access Panel, you should get automatically signed-on to your Halogen Software application.
trans-unit.target: When you click the Halogen Software tile in the Access Panel, you should get automatically signed-on to your Halogen Software application.
